title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
text: DigestiveDataSets package offers comprehensive curated collection datasets focused digestive system, including stomach, intestines, liver, pancreas, related disorders. package encompasses variety data types clinical trials, observational studies, experimental datasets, cohort data, case series, providing broad coverage gastrointestinal diseases. Included datasets span range conditions gastritis, ulcers, pancreatitis, liver cirrhosis, colorectal diseases, colon cancer, Helicobacter pylori infection, irritable bowel syndrome, intestinal infections, post-surgical outcomes. datasets serve multiple purposes education, clinical practice, biomedical research, particularly valuable fields gastroenterology, public health, epidemiology.

title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
text: dataset DigestiveDataSets package uses suffix denote type R object: _df: data frame _tbl_df: tibble _ts: time series selected example datasets included DigestiveDataSets package: digestive_cancer_survival_df: Digestive Cancer Survival Times. campylobacter_infections_ts: Campylobacter Infections Time Series. cholera_deaths_1849_tbl_df: Cholera Daily Deaths England, 1849.

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with DigestiveDataSets Data
title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
code: # Minimal data processing WITHOUT tidyr digestive_cancer_survival_df %>%   summarise(     Stomach = sum(stomach, na.rm = TRUE),     Colon = sum(colon, na.rm = TRUE)   ) %>%    # Convert to plot-ready format WITHOUT tidyr   {data.frame(     Cancer = names(.),     Cases = unlist(., use.names = FALSE)   )} %>%    # Plot   ggplot(aes(x = Cancer, y = Cases)) +   geom_col(fill = c("#e63946", "#1d3557")) +   labs(title = "Stomach vs Colon Cancer Cases") +   theme_minimal()

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with DigestiveDataSets Data
title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
code: # Convert ts to numeric vector and numeric time campy_df <- data.frame(   infections = as.numeric(campylobacter_infections_ts),   time = as.numeric(time(campylobacter_infections_ts)) )  # Plot without warning by using numeric 'time' ggplot(campy_df, aes(x = time, y = infections)) +   geom_line(color = "steelblue") +   geom_point(color = "steelblue") +   labs(     title = "Campylobacter Infections Over Time",     x = "Time (year.fraction)",     y = "Number of Infections"   ) +   theme_minimal()

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with DigestiveDataSets Data
title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
code: ggplot(cholera_deaths_1849_tbl_df, aes(x = date, y = deaths, color = cause_of_death)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     title = "Cholera Deaths Over Time in 1849",     x = "Date",     y = "Number of Deaths",     color = "Cause of Death"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to DigestiveDataSets
text: DigestiveDataSets package offers comprehensive, well-curated collection datasets focused digestive system related diseases. including clinical trials, observational studies, cohort data, experimental datasets covering broad spectrum gastrointestinal conditions, package supports wide range applications research, education, clinical practice. detailed information full documentation dataset, please refer reference manual help files included within package.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Caceres Rossi R (2025). DigestiveDataSets: Curated Collection Digestive System Gastrointestinal Disease Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/digestivedatasets.
code: @Manual{,   title = {DigestiveDataSets: A Curated Collection of Digestive System and Gastrointestinal Disease Datasets},   author = {Renzo {Caceres Rossi}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/lightbluetitan/digestivedatasets}, }

title: A Curated Collection of Digestive System and Gastrointestinal Disease Datasets
code: # Load the package  library(DigestiveDataSets)  # List all datasets in the package  view_datasets_digestive()  # Load dataset  data(digestive_cancer_survival_df)  # Preview the dataset  head(digestive_cancer_survival_df)  # Open in Viewer  View(digestive_cancer_survival_df)

title: Campylobacter Infections Time Series — campylobacter_infections_ts
text: dataset, campylobacter_infections_ts, time series object containing number cases campylobacter infections northern Quebec (Canada), recorded four-week intervals January 1990 October 2000. Campylobacterosis acute bacterial infectious disease attacking digestive system.

text: time series object (`ts`) 140 observations: Start c(1990, 1) End c(2000, 10) Frequency 13 (observations per year)

title: Campylobacter Infections Time Series — campylobacter_infections_ts
text: Data taken tscount package version 1.4.3. Original source: Ferland, R., Latour, . Oraichi, D., "Integer-valued GARCH process". Journal Time Series Analysis, 2006; 27(6): 923–942.

title: SmartPill Intestinal Transit — intestinal_smartpill_df
text: dataset, intestinal_smartpill_df, data frame prospective cohort study evaluating gastric emptying, small bowel transit time, total intestinal transit time using SmartPill motility capsule. study involved 8 critically ill trauma patients 87 healthy volunteers. capsule wirelessly transmitted pH, pressure, temperature recorder attached subject's abdomen.

title: SmartPill Intestinal Transit — intestinal_smartpill_df
text: data frame 95 observations 22 variables: Group Numeric indicator group membership Gender Numeric indicator gender Race Numeric code indicating racial background Height Height centimeters Weight Weight kilograms Age Age years GE.Time Gastric emptying time (minutes) SB.Time Small bowel transit time (minutes) C.Time Colon transit time (minutes) WG.Time Whole gut transit time (minutes) S.Contractions Number contractions stomach S.Sum..Amplitudes Sum contraction amplitudes stomach S.Mean.Peak.Amplitude Mean peak amplitude stomach S.Mean.pH Mean pH level stomach SB.Contractions Number contractions small bowel SB.Sum..Amplitudes Sum contraction amplitudes small bowel SB.Mean.Peak.Amplitude Mean peak amplitude small bowel SB.Mean.pH Mean pH level small bowel Colon.Contractions Number contractions colon Colon.Sum..Amplitudes Sum contraction amplitudes colon C.Mean.Peak.Amplitude Mean peak amplitude colon C.Mean.pH Mean pH level colon

title: SmartPill Intestinal Transit — intestinal_smartpill_df
text: Data taken medicaldata package version 0.2.0. Original source: Rauch et al., "Use Wireless Utility Capsule Determine Gastric Emptying Small Intestinal Transit Times Critically Ill Trauma Patients". Journal Critical Care, 2012; 27(5): 534.e7–534.e12.

title: Pancreatic Cancer Clinical Trial — pancreatic_cancer_df
text: dataset, pancreatic_cancer_df, data frame containing data Phase II clinical trial patients locally advanced metastatic pancreatic cancer. includes time--event data disease progression death, well staging information.

what: Mayo Clinic Primary Biliary Cirrhosis — pbc_mayo_survival_df
title: Mayo Clinic Primary Biliary Cirrhosis — pbc_mayo_survival_df
text: dataset, pbc_mayo_survival_df, data frame containing data randomized control trial conducted Mayo Clinic 1974 1984, studying progression primary biliary cirrhosis. dataset includes survival longitudinal measurements 1945 observations across 16 clinical variables.

title: Indomethacin for Post-ERCP Pancreatitis — post_ercp_pancreatitis_tbl_df
text: dataset, post_ercp_pancreatitis_tbl_df, tibble containing results randomized, placebo-controlled, prospective 2-arm trial rectal indomethacin (100 mg) versus placebo prevent post-ERCP pancreatitis 602 participants, reported Elmunzer, Higgins, et al. (2012) New England Journal Medicine.

title: Indomethacin for Post-ERCP Pancreatitis — post_ercp_pancreatitis_tbl_df
text: tibble 602 observations 33 variables: id Numeric subject identifier site Factor indicating study site (4 levels) age Numeric age participant risk Numeric risk score gender Factor indicating gender (2 levels) outcome Factor indicating study outcome (2 levels) sod Factor indicating presence sphincter Oddi dysfunction (2 levels) pep Factor indicating presence post-ERCP pancreatitis (2 levels) recpanc Factor indicating recurrent pancreatitis (2 levels) psphinc Factor indicating pancreatic sphincterotomy (2 levels) precut Factor indicating precut sphincterotomy (2 levels) difcan Factor indicating difficult cannulation (2 levels) pneudil Factor indicating pneumatic dilation (2 levels) amp Factor indicating ampullary interventions (2 levels) paninj Factor indicating pancreatic injury (2 levels) acinar Factor indicating acinarization (2 levels) brush Factor indicating brushing procedures (2 levels) asa81 Factor indicating ASA 81 mg use (3 levels) asa325 Factor indicating ASA 325 mg use (3 levels) asa Factor indicating ASA status (3 levels) prophystent Factor indicating prophylactic stent placement (2 levels) therastent Factor indicating therapeutic stent use (2 levels) pdstent Factor indicating pancreatic duct stent (2 levels) sodsom Factor indicating somatostatin use SOD (2 levels) bsphinc Factor indicating biliary sphincterotomy (2 levels) bstent Factor indicating biliary stent (2 levels) chole Factor indicating cholecystectomy (2 levels) pbmal Factor indicating presence pancreaticobiliary malignancy (2 levels) train Factor indicating performed trainee (2 levels) status Factor indicating trial status (2 levels) type Factor indicating procedure type (4 levels) rx Factor indicating treatment group: placebo indomethacin (2 levels) bleed Numeric bleeding indicator
